relationships.description: Moth answers yes to the Glory, Velvet answers no.
Lionsmith creates monsters to defeat the Colonel, but the Colonel's scars are weapons.
The Wood grows outside the walls of the Mansus, yet the Mansus has no walls.
He repeatedly visited the Wood in his silver dreams.
Illopoly believed Elagabalus was a puppet or incarnation of the Sun-in-Rags.
Elagabalus finally found the White Door.
The White is west of the world; the White Door is associated with the White.
Baldomei wanted the Stag Door.
Even the Sun-in-Splendour can be divided, though it required the Forge of Days to act.
She studied dreams of craftsmen about the Wood.
She recorded that the most skilled craftsmen dreamed of the White Door.
Mother of Ants guards both up and down on the stairs of the Mansus.
The White Door might be the wound; to pass, must go through the wound, and she guards both sides.
Janus is seen as the Watchman.
Janus is seen as the Twins (Witch-and-Sister).
Janus is seen as the Mother of Ants.
Janus is seen as the Forge.
Janus is seen as the Meniscate.
Janus is seen as the Madrugad.
Hush insisted that the Hours are Janus.
Coseley preferred that the Hours are not Janus.
Hush and Coseley disagreed on whether the Hours are Janus.
Hush warns against Coseley, describing him as 'worm of worms'.
The book is about Winter and its romance with the Sun; The White is associated with Winter.
Solomon Herschel wrote about The White.
Apollo flayed Marsyas after losing the music contest.
Marsyas's skin was made into a drum.
Priestesses of Cybele made the drum and used it.
The priestesses serve Cybele.
Sir Percival seeks the Red Grail.
The Peacock Door is a door in the Mansus.
The book hints at a connection between Witch-and-Sister and the Velvet.
The Pine Knight seeks the Cinnabar Cup.
After the knight castrated and flayed himself, Wakeful Storm emerged from his remains.
The Mother of Mountains and Wakeful Storm have a dialogue and share a law.
The law of the Sun is mentioned.
Wakeful Storm adheres to the Sun's law.
A scarred man (likely the Colonel) drags Chione out of the city.
Chione is a snow goddess associated with winter.
Successful members passed through the Stag Door.
Inspired by Controlled Fire (the Forge).
They attained the position of Know.
Saint Tryphon passed through the Horned Gate.
He achieved the Great Birth.
He obtained the seven seals.
The book is dedicated to Saint Tryphon.
Sisters of the Knot are part of the Knot faction.
The Horned Gate is likely associated with the Horned Axe.
The book is dedicated to Saint Nymph.
The heretical branch seeks ascension in the name of the Watchman.
One must pass through the Wood after the Stag Door to obtain the third seal.
One must climb to the White Door after passing through the Wood.
In Gryph's sight, the Stag Door awaits the light-bearers.
Madrugad presides over the path into the Mansus.
The Rite of the White commemorates Madrugad.
The aspect of Knock reigns above because the Mother of Ants is the mother of salvation.
Mother of Ants is the mother of salvation.
Matthias and the Amethyst Imago are lovers.
The Vagabond gave the Rite of the Map's Edge.
The ritual can be used to summon the Amethyst Imago.
They dedicated themselves to the Forge for transformation.
They dedicated themselves to the Forge for transformation.
The Amethyst Imago was playing with the Witch-and-Sister.
She returned to the Wood to seek forgiveness from the Moth, who sent her on a mission.
Matthias hunts Names under the Moth.
They learned the joy of the Cup (Grail).
They learned the joy of the Cup.
Bancroft learned from Fiona Alshire, the Rose Witch.
As the Rose Witch, she likely serves the Flowermaker.
He taught the Thunderskin to juggle.
They claim to inherit the traditions of the Obliviate Family.
They use a ritual to summon the Vapor Spirit.
The Serpent Door is the sacred door of the Mother of Ants.
The Hooded Princes pass through this door.
Moth is closest to worms and knows their weaknesses.
Winter is closest to worms.
The Lionsmith can defeat worms.
The Centipede is active in the Mansus and in Mia.
Moth is a Wood Hour.
Velvet is a Wood Hour.
Ring-Yew is a Wood Hour.
Kanishka betrayed Locke Kahuli.
Centurion forced Kanishka to serve him.
At the Spider Door.
Forge loved the Sun.
Red Grail anticipated their union.
Sisters of the Knot serve Ring-Yew.
Sisters of the Knot serve Horned Axe.
Priestesses of the Red Grail serve her.
Twins entered Mansus.
Red Grail helped them enter Mansus.
Author condemns Red Grail.
Hieronymus criticizes Sisters of the Knot.
Hieronymus is a member of the Invincible Sun Church.
Thunderskin loves Ring-Yew.
Red Grail destroyed Thunderskin as compensation.
Thunderskin entered Mansus via the Peacock Door.
Sisters of the Knot belong to the Knot faction.
Invincible Sun Church belongs to the Solar faction.
Thunderskin loves Ring-Yew.
Red Grail destroyed Thunderskin.
Thunderskin entered through the Peacock Door.
Hooded Princes can create lions.
Some lions serve the Golden General.
Hooded Princes influenced wars in the Great River Valley.
Crucible Lord serves the Burning Queen (Forge).
Forge shares desire with the Sun.
Shedskin was a member of the Hooded Princes.
Shedskin followed Thunderskin.
Hooded Princes are angry at Shedskin's defection.
A spell guides from the Hunter's Door to the Serpent Door.
Hooded Princes pray to the Key Serpent.
Hooded Princes pray to the Twins.
Hooded Princes pray to the Queen of Mirrors.
Hooded Princes beg the Wood for aid.
Moth is one of the Wood's spirits.
Twins are associated with the Wood.
Honey Tree is associated with the Wood.
Hooded Princes seek help from the Keeper of the Hole.
Alexander obtained names of the Blind God (Colonel).
Alexander brought back the Sacred Betrayal Ritual.
Lars Westgren explored Mansus.
Limiae Order can summon the Crucible King.
Crucible King serves Forge of Days.
Melele Ivni came from the Watery Crossroads.
Buzgash served Bone Dove before joining the order.
Buzgash came from the City of the Carrier Eagle.
Hong fled from the Chrysanthemum Court.
Limiae Order has an agreement with Bone Dove.
Bone Dove preserves memory of Wheel.
Bone Dove preserves memory of Flint.
Bone Dove preserves memory of Tide.
Bone Dove preserves memory of Seven-Coils.
Bone Dove preserves memory of Egg Unhatching.
Watchman might forgive Egg Unhatching.
Colonel slew the seven monsters (Seven-Coils).
Colonel went to the House above the Wood (Mansus).
Forge opened the way to Mansus.
Forge's first forbidden act gave birth to Flowermaker.
Red Grail lured a great musician who became Thunderskin.
Red Grail allowed the Twins to ascend.
Red Grail became jealous of the Twins.
Hooded Princes originally were her children.
Hooded Princes formed an alliance with Mother of Ants.
War between Hooded Princes and Obliviate Family.
Hooded Princes involved in conquest of the Great River Valley.
Obliviate Family was inspired by the Centipede.
Descendants of Perseus worship the Scarred One (Colonel).
Golden General served as disciple of the Colonel.
Golden General served the Shadowless Empire.
King of Kings whispered a secret to Golden General.
Golden General entered the Temple behind the World.
Colonel slew Seven-Coils.
Red Grail consumed Tide.
Endless Legion is commanded by the Colonel.
Endless Legion defends Rome against the Shadowless Empire.
Golden General is enemy of the Colonel.
Cassius was an envoy of the Colonel.
The history of the Two Witches is tied to Grail's torments.
Shadowless Empire fought invasion by Hooded Princes.
Shadowless Empire attacked the Great River Valley.
Invincible Sun Church worships Sun-in-Splendour.
Church also worships Madrugad.
Church also worships Sun-in-Rags.
Church also worships Meniscate.
Concourse is in the Mansus.
Rituals include homage to Red Grail.
Rituals include homage to Ring-Yew.
Rituals include homage to Horned Axe.
Rituals include homage to Thunderskin.
The church is part of the Solar faction.
Laughing Thrush is a mask of the Vagabond.
Centipede is a mask of the Vagabond.
Pilgrim is a mask of the Vagabond.
Scene Thief is a mask of the Vagabond.
Laughing Thrush was close friends with Sun-in-Splendour.
Scene Thief drew rivers in the Mansus.
Centipede's birthplace is the city of Mia.
Centipede cursed the city of Mia.
Athena Vanna studied the Vagabond.
Red Grail had a lover who tried to become a Hour.
Vagabond meets at the Roost.
Bone Dove meets at the Roost.
Beachcomber meets at the Roost.
Witch-and-Sister meet at the Roost.
Red Grail drank dry the Tide.
Moth usurped the Wheel from within.
Forge overshadowed then shattered Flint.
Author is a member of Limiae Order.
Colonel slew Seven-Coils.
Priestess helped the Colonel.
Priestess anointed with Seven-Coils' blood.
Colonel attacked the Temple behind the World.
Priestess accompanied attack.
Soham claimed to have spoken with Beachcomber.
Vagabond travels through Mansus.
Vagabond travels through Wood.
Forge split the Sun, killing him.
Beachcomber meets at the Roost.
Vagabond meets at the Roost.
Bone Dove meets at the Roost.
Witch-and-Sister meet at the Roost.

about worms
claimed the book was written by insects
Lady Yi demonstrated an entertainment method originating from the Book of Centipede.
The Book of Centipede concerns the entity Centipede.
Locke Kahuli wrote the Account of Kanishka at the Spider's Door, possibly after death.
The account describes Kanishka's encounter at the Spider's Door.
The account is set at the Spider's Door.
Locke Kahuli was a lover and victim of Kanishka.
Everett Vinzant transcribed the inscription from a cliff in Anatolia.
Christopher Larquebine acquired copies of the Larquebine Codex from a witch family.
The third copy of the Larquebine Codex was dedicated to the sea, possibly referencing the Tide.
Hieronymus wrote a critique of the Sisterhood of the Knot.
The book criticizes the Sisterhood of the Knot and their degenerate practices.
The book discusses the evil influence of the Sisterhood on the Invincible Sun Church.
Hieronymus was a member of the Invincible Sun Church.
The Sisterhood exerted evil influence on the Church, implying conflict.
The Morphy Codex is a document of the Sisterhood of the Knot.
Evan Morphy excavated the codex.
Ashley Phillips is listed as translator in the most notorious edition, though the preface denies any translator.
The book exhibits characteristics of texts that mention the Hooded Princes.
Michael Blockley, an eccentric steel magnate, liked to quote the Incandescent Tantra.
C.G. Brill published excerpts of the Thirsting Tantra in a temperance pamphlet.
The Flayed Tantra was dictated by the mysterious figure Shedskin.
Alexander Spay's paranoid pamphlet heavily features the Flayed Tantra.
Dafydd Jones claimed to own the only copy of the Watchful Tantra.
Meredith Bryan claimed to own the only copy of the Watchful Tantra.
They dueled over ownership of the Watchful Tantra in 1840, leading to their deaths.
Harvey Harrington stole the only known copy from the British Library and later ate it with butter and garlic.
Joe of the Bridge, a retired soldier, wrote the epic As the Sun His Course.
The epic tells of Alexander the Great's inexplicable retreat at Issus and return to Macedon.
The retreat at Issus is a key event in the epic.
Lars Westgren, explorer and murderer, wrote the Concourse Diaries.
The diaries concern the Concourse.
The Iron Book is a guidebook of the Limiae Order.
The Silver Book is a guidebook of the Limiae Order.
The Ivory Book is a guidebook of the Limiae Order.
Joshua the Brown found the book in a well in Hama.
Unreliable legend claims the book was abandoned by Alexander during his retreat from Issus.
Legend connects the book to Alexander's retreat from Issus.
The book was found in a well in Hama.
Pavel Shuga, a mercenary, painstakingly collected the Deeds of the Scarred Captain while living in Greece.
The book records deeds of the Scarred Captain, an alias for the Colonel.
Alexander Probst restored a copy of the Book of Dissolution based on the foundational work of Jay Vigo Jansen.
Jay Vigo Jansen did foundational work on the Book of Dissolution.
The Dark Gentleman is the only recognized author of the Catalogue of Uncharted Pleasures, and his identification was made with great fanfare.
Brodenax authored the Fucine-language mystical study Those Who Do Not Sleep.
Keller composed the ascetic poem The Sky the Soul.
The poem was written at the court of the Shadowless Kings.
William Midnight illustrated the Vak text On the Matter and the Deeds of Serpents in the 1880s in Paris.
The Serenity of Blackwood is an allegorical history of the Obliviate Family.
The book implies the Obliviate Family was inspired by the centipede.
Alexander Peterhans transcribed the Book of Thrones from annales of a hidden temple in Anatolia.
The book contains legends of the Shadowless Empire.
Yousai, a priest and recluse, authored the Second Glory.
Cassius, a follower of St. Thomas, wrote the Book of True Blood.
Menander the Victor is credited as the playwright or translator of the Burning Woman, a Phrygian play.
Nils Frederic Maskell attempted to paint the torments described in the book, leading to his death from blood loss.
Isaac of Cas wrote the True and Accurate History of the Shadowless Kings.
The book is a history of the Shadowless Empire.
The High Mysteries of the Solar Church records secret rites of the Invincible Sun Church.
Medusa's Lament describes the death of the Hour Seven-Coils, also known as Mother's Father.
Athena Vanna's research notes on the Vagabond Hour.
The Book of Masks is a study of the Vagabond, the wandering Hour of the Roost.
Nina Gal of Lagash authored In the Mountains as Upon the Plain, Perhaps No Unreached Path.
Son of Grave, a Gallic apprentice who joined the River Marsh Order, authored Memory of Gods.
The book recounts the destruction of the Stone Hours, the gods before humanity.
Son of Grave joined the River Marsh Order.
The Sevenfold Slaying of the Seven-Coiled records the destruction of the ancient Stone Hour, likely Seven-Coils.
Damoon Aznanten, a disgraced oracle, compiled the Dream Conspiracy of Skies.
The story of the Book of the White Cat was transmitted to Penelope of Gordion by a blind white cat.
A blind white cat conveyed the story to Penelope of Gordion, resulting in the Book of the White Cat.
Omar the Blazing composed Focus Amber during ascetic practice.
Mika Xi authored the Song of the Carapace Cross, a work that is often damaged.
Where Has She Gone? discusses the travels of the Vagabond, a wandering Hour.
Xiao Hei, a wandering scholar, discussed five possible origins of humanity in Five Creations.
The book is accompanied by a masked figure that Xiao Hei calls the Beachcomber.
Black Aili was the leader of the Damascus Sisterhood of the Knot.
Black Aili ordered the secret doctrines to be recorded as Commands for the Preservation of All Things.
The book contains secret teachings of the Sisterhood.
Emperor Didius Julianus imprisoned Black Aili.
Didius Julianus ordered the book buried with Black Aili in an unmarked tomb.
Authored the book.

The event involves the splitting of the Sun-in-Splendour.
